title: A Phase 1b Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group, Multi-center Study to Determine the Safety and Tolerability of HTL0018318 in Subjects With Alzheimer's Disease Receiving Standard-of-care
description_brief: Multi-centre study of HTL0018318 in patients with Alzheimer's disease as an add-on to standard-of-care
description_detailed: This is a multi-centre study conducted in four countries. A total of 60 subjects with Alzheimer's disease who are on standard-of-care will be enrolled to receive one of 3 active HTL0018318 or placebo for a period of four weeks
drug: HTL0018318 (selective muscarinic M1 receptor partial agonist; small-molecule)
explanation_target: Reason: The described investigational product, HTL0018318, is a selective muscarinic M1 receptor partial agonist being developed as a symptomatic (pro‑cognitive) treatment for cognitive dysfunction in Alzheimer's disease and other dementias — i.e., it targets cholinergic neurotransmission to improve attention/memory rather than targeting core AD pathology (amyloid/tau). citeturn0search4turn0search6

Act: Key trial details — Phase 1b randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑controlled, add‑on to standard‑of‑care (donepezil) in AD patients. HTL0018318 has shown pro‑cognitive effects on attention and memory endpoints in early trials and is described in the literature as a small‑molecule M1 agonist intended for symptomatic cognitive enhancement. citeturn0search1turn0search5

Reflect: Classification rationale — Because HTL0018318 is a small‑molecule muscarinic M1 receptor agonist developed to improve cognitive function (symptomatic enhancement) and is not a biologic nor described as modifying amyloid or tau pathology, it fits the 'cognitive enhancer' category rather than a disease‑targeted biologic or disease‑targeted small molecule (disease‑modifying). No evidence in the cited sources indicates disease‑modifying intent. citeturn0search6turn0search4

Web search results (key sources used): 1) Phase 1b/2a multicenter study reporting safety and preliminary pharmacodynamic (pro‑cognitive) effects of HTL0018318 in mild‑to‑moderate AD (Nathan et al.). citeturn0search1turn0search5 2) Multiple ascending dose and healthy volunteer studies describing HTL0018318 as a selective M1 receptor partial agonist with pro‑cognitive effects on short‑term memory/learning. citeturn0search6turn0search3 3) PMC full text on safety/pharmacokinetics describing HTL0018318 as a selective M1 receptor partial agonist developed for symptomatic treatment of dementias. citeturn0search4 4) Company press/update noting HTL0018318 as a small‑molecule M1 agonist in clinical development for symptomatic cognitive treatment. citeturn0search7
explanation_agent: Reason: HTL0018318 is described as a selective muscarinic M1 receptor partial agonist — i.e., it acts on a cholinergic neurotransmitter receptor to produce symptomatic (pro‑cognitive) effects rather than targeting core AD pathology such as amyloid or tau.

Act: Extracted trial details — Phase 1b, randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑controlled, add‑on to standard‑of‑care (donepezil) in AD; investigational drug is HTL0018318, a small‑molecule selective muscarinic M1 receptor partial agonist developed for symptomatic cognitive enhancement. Based on this mechanism (direct modulation of a neurotransmitter receptor), assign 'D) Neurotransmitter Receptors'.

Reflect: This classification aligns with CADRO because the intervention targets a neurotransmitter receptor (muscarinic M1) to improve attention/memory (symptomatic cognitive enhancement). There is no indication in the description that the drug is intended to modify amyloid, tau, inflammation, or other disease‑modifying pathways, nor that multiple distinct targets are being addressed — therefore 'D) Neurotransmitter Receptors' is the most specific CADRO category.

Web search results (key sources used / paraphrased): 1) Phase 1b/2a multicenter study reporting safety and preliminary pharmacodynamic (pro‑cognitive) effects of HTL0018318 in mild‑to‑moderate AD (Nathan et al.). 2) Multiple ascending dose and healthy volunteer studies describing HTL0018318 as a selective M1 receptor partial agonist with pro‑cognitive effects on short‑term memory/learning. 3) PMC full‑text article on safety/pharmacokinetics describing HTL0018318 as a selective M1 receptor partial agonist developed for symptomatic treatment of dementias. 4) Company press/update noting HTL0018318 as a small‑molecule M1 agonist in clinical development for symptomatic cognitive treatment.
